description: n-th positive integer having distinct base 2 run lengths.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller and Gheorghe Coserea, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000 (first 5000 terms from Reinhard Zumkeller)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (group, nub)a044813 n = a044813_list !! (n-1)a044813_list = filter p [1..] where   p x = nub xs == xs where         xs = map length $ group $ a030308_row x-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 02 2013(PARI)is(n) = {  my(v = 0, hist = vector(1 + logint(n+1, 2)));  while(n != 0,        v = valuation(n, 2); n >>= v; n++;        hist[v+1]++; if (hist[v+1] >= 2, return(0));        v = valuation(n, 2); n >>= v; n--;        hist[v+1]++; if (hist[v+1] >= 2, return(0)));  return(1);};seq(n) = {  my(k = 1, top = 0, v = vector(n));  while(top < n, if (is(k), v[top++] = k); k++);  return(v);};seq(59) \\ _Gheorghe Coserea_, Nov 02 2015
author: _Clark Kimberling_
